skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill with a minimal audit requirement. No security concerns were identified in the reviewed text content.

content.user_title: Draft documentation with a guided coauthoring workflow
content.value_statement: Documentation work often misses key context and reader clarity. This workflow guides you through structured drafting, refinement, and reader testing.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through context gathering questions for document goals and audience.
Builds section outlines with placeholders for structured documents.
Iteratively drafts and refines sections based on user selections.
Runs reader testing with a fresh agent when available.
Asks clarifying questions to close context gaps before drafting.
limitations: Requires users to provide the core content and decisions.
Cannot access external documents or channels without enabled integrations.
Does not verify factual accuracy or external links.
Reader testing depends on sub agent availability.

use_cases.title: Write a decision doc
use_cases.description: Create a clear decision document with audience goals, options, and rationale.

use_cases.title: Draft a technical spec
use_cases.description: Structure a spec with approach, trade offs, and implementation steps.

use_cases.title: Prepare a proposal
use_cases.description: Build a proposal with context, constraints, and expected impact.

prompt_templates.title: Start a doc
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to write a new document
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to write a decision doc. Guide me through your structured workflow and start with the context questions.

prompt_templates.title: Outline a spec
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a spec idea but no structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a section outline for a technical spec and create placeholders. Ask me which section to start with.

prompt_templates.title: Refine a section
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to improve one section
prompt_templates.prompt: Work on the Technical Approach section. Ask questions, brainstorm options, and draft the section after I choose items.

prompt_templates.title: Reader testing
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a final clarity check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run reader testing on my completed document and report any gaps or ambiguities.

output_examples.input: Help me draft a PRD using your workflow. Start with the context questions.
output: Asked for doc type, audience, impact, and constraints
Provided next steps for structuring sections

best_practices: Share goals, audience, and constraints early.
Respond to clarifying questions with concise answers.
Iterate section by section instead of full rewrites.
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and jumping to drafting.
Editing the whole document without feedback on priorities.
Providing vague feedback like make it better.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The workflow works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code with the same prompts.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It needs your content and decisions. It does not verify facts or access external docs without connectors.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my shared documents?
faq.answer: It can if connectors or integrations are enabled. Otherwise you must paste the content.

faq.question: Is my data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No data storage is described in the skill. Data handling depends on your platform settings.

faq.question: What if the workflow feels slow?
faq.answer: Skip stages or answer in shorthand. You can request a faster, freeform mode.

faq.question: How does it compare to freeform drafting?
faq.answer: This adds structure, context capture, and reader testing to reduce gaps and confusion.
